newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israeli shekel weakens against dollar, basket.
newsitem.headline: Israeli shekel weakens against dollar, basket.

text.p: The Israeli shekel weakened against the dollar and the basket of foreign currencies in very quiet trading following the dollar's rise against the mark, dealers said.

"Activity remains low. The rise of the dollar abroad affected local trading, but it is clear there are investors who still hold dollars and are waiting for an opportunity to sell," said a dealer at Bank Hapoalim.
"The shekel is trading in tight ranges and whenever it weakens a little investors start selling foreign currency," he said.

The representative rate for the dollar was 3.1560 against 3.1470 on Wednesday. The basket, composed of the dollar, mark, pound sterling, French franc and yen, closed at 3.5450 shekels against 3.5418 on Wednesday.
On the crosses the shekel traded against the yen at 2.9073 shekels per 100 yen against 2.9037 on Wednesday and against the mark at 2.1111 shekels per mark against 2.1215 on Wednesday.
In late afternoon the dollar was trading at 3.1550 shekels.
